question: What is the first step to begin the EXT API SonarQube setup?
context: EXT api sonar setup Go to sonar url

question: After navigating to the SonarQube URL, what should you do next?
context: Login Sonar url using below details and other details are given below

answers.text: Login Sonar url using below details

question: How do you initiate the creation of a new SonarQube project for EXT API?
context: Click on create project

question: Which project creation method should be selected in SonarQube for this setup?
context: Click project >manually (give project name ,click setup ,after setting up token will be shown in screen

question: What information must you provide when creating a project manually in SonarQube?
context: Click project >manually (give project name ,click setup ,after setting up token will be shown in screen

question: What is displayed on screen after successfully setting up a project in SonarQube?
context: after setting up token will be shown in screen

question: Where is the SonarQube shell script located that needs to be modified?
context: Go to sonar shell script in the workspace

question: What type of file should you open to configure SonarQube scanning?
context: Open the sh file and replace below things has to be replaced

question: What Maven command is used to execute the SonarQube analysis?
context: mvn org.sonarsource.scanner.maven:sonar-maven-plugin:3.9.1.2184:sonar \

question: What is the SonarQube project key used in the example configuration?
context: -Dsonar.projectKey=PSD.JAPAC.CSC.FO.EXT.API.25.1 \

question: What is the SonarQube server URL specified in the configuration?
context: -Dsonar.host.url=http://100.76.172.28:19030 \ (Sonar url)

question: Which parameter disables OJAudit during the SonarQube scan?
context: -Dsonar.ojaudit.enabled=false \

question: What is the purpose of the -Dsonar.login parameter?
context: -Dsonar.login=sqp_6c5e04a2bf67ba703ff9e81f8a8f3402a39851f1 \ (this token will bw generated after setting up project)

answers.text: to authenticate the SonarScanner using a token generated after project setup

question: Are unit tests executed during the SonarQube analysis in this setup?
context: -Dmaven.test.skip=true \

question: What is the local Maven repository path configured in the Sonar script?
context: -Dmaven.repo.local=/scratch/Build/m2/repository/ORM_MAVEN_REPO_V1/repository \

question: How should you execute the SonarQube analysis script?
context: -o Run sh file in putty

question: What is the expected outcome after running the Sonar script?
context: build should be successful

question: How do you verify that the SonarQube analysis completed successfully?
context: Check sonar dashboard for respective project the date should be updated for code coverage

answers.text: Check sonar dashboard for respective project—the date should be updated for code coverage

context: 10.click on cnes report>select the project

question: Which report format must be enabled to download an Excel file?
context: only check and enable xlsx report

question: What action triggers the report generation process?
context: Click on Generate

question: What is delivered after successfully generating the CNES report?
context: Zip file should be downloaded.

context: mvn org.sonarsource.scanner.maven:sonar-maven-plugin:3.9.1.2184:sonar \

context: the date should be updated for code coverage

context: -Dmaven.test.skip=true \

context: mvn org.sonarsource.scanner.maven:sonar-maven-plugin:3.9.1.2184:sonar

question: What repository path is used to avoid downloading dependencies from the internet?

context: click on more at the top bar 10.click on cnes report

question: Are other report options changed when generating the XLSX report?

question: What file extension does the downloaded report have?

question: What is the primary purpose of the shell script in this setup?

question: What does the token in -Dsonar.login represent?
context: (this token will bw generated after setting up project)

question: What indicates a successful build in the SonarQube integration process?

question: Which SonarQube feature provides downloadable quality metrics in Excel format?
context: click on cnes report>select the project > ... only check and enable xlsx report

question: What are the key steps in the EXT API SonarQube setup workflow?
context: Go to sonar url → Login → Click on create project → Click project > manually → give project name → click setup → token shown → edit sh file → run in putty → verify dashboard → download report

answers.text: Create project manually, obtain token, configure shell script, run analysis, verify dashboard, and download CNES report

question: What are the first two prerequisites for the SO 25.3 local containerization setup?
context: Local Setup Guide 1. Setup Podman and wsl-vpn-kit. (Refer to “WSL and Podman Setup for Spingboot with OracleDB ENV.docx”) 2. Setup podman compose (Check the embedded document)

question: Where can you find all available container images for the project?
context: You can search “finergy-jpac-csc-bnpp” in search box for all the available images and paths.

question: What is the purpose of generating an Access Token in the Artifact Repository?
context: Now we will be generating an Access Token, which will be used to pull & push images.

question: How do you generate an Identity Token in the Artifact Repository?
context: Click on profile dropdown and click on Edit Profile. 7. Click on “Generate an Identity Token” 8. Give an description to identify your token and click on Next.

answers.text: Click on Edit Profile → Generate an Identity Token → add description → click Next

question: Why must you save the generated token immediately?
context: Make sure to copy the token somewhere and save it as it will be required to login.

answers.text: it will be required to login

question: How do you verify if the Podman machine is running?
context: Check if your podman machine is running or not by doing “wsl -l -v”.

question: What command starts the Podman machine?
context: Start podman machine by doing “podman machine start”

question: How do you start wsl-vpn-kit after the Podman machine is running?
context: you can start wsl-vpn-kit by doing “wsl.exe -d wsl-vpnkit -cd /app wsl-vpnkit”

question: What must you keep open while wsl-vpn-kit is running?
context: Keep the window or tab open, DO NOT CLOSE IT or stop the process.

question: What is the Podman login command for the project’s artifact repository?
context: Run “podman login finergy-jpac-csc-bnpp.dockerhub-iad.oci.oraclecorp.com”

question: What credentials are used to log in to the artifact repository via terminal?
context: Provide your SSO username (email) and click enter. 6. Provide the access token we copied for password and hit enter.

answers.text: SSO username (email) and access token as password

question: Which Maven image is pulled from the artifact repository?
context: podman pull finergy-jpac-csc-bnpp.dockerhub-iad.oci.oraclecorp.com/base-images/maven3.9.1-jdk21.0.7:1.0.0

question: Which Oracle JDK image is used in the setup?
context: podman pull finergy-jpac-csc-bnpp.dockerhub-iad.oci.oraclecorp.com/base-images/container-registry.oracle.com/java/jdk:21.0.7

question: When should you disconnect the Cisco VPN during image pulling?
context: After this we will disconnect the Cisco VPN and pull these images. - Nginx podman pull nginx:alpine - Node podman pull node:18.17.1-alpine - Kong podman pull kong:3.9

answers.text: before pulling public images like nginx, node, and kong

question: What is the name of the ZIP file containing required file changes for containerization?
context: Download the “SO_25.3_Containers_required_file_changes.zip” from SO_25.3_containerization_required_file_changes.zip

question: Where should you place the extracted containerization folder?
context: Extract the folder, copy the folder, and place it in your C:\ drive.

question: When should you NOT replace the files in the source_code folder?
context: If you want to containerize the application then do not replace the files present under SO_25.3_containerization_required_file_changes/ source_code

answers.text: when you want to containerize the application

question: What command builds the Kong API image?
context: Go to bnpp_csc_so/kongapi and run this command. “podman build -t cscso-kong .”

question: Why is the dot (.) necessary at the end of the podman build command?
context: The “ . ” at the end of build command is necessary as it represents the current directory where the Dockerfile is located.

answers.text: it represents the current directory where the Dockerfile is located

question: List all the Spring Boot microservices that need to be built.
context: cscso-login-service - cscso-outbound-service - cscso-reports-service - cscso-supplier-activation-service - cscso-program-onboarding-service

question: Where is the Angular application located for containerization?
context: Go to bnpp_csc_so/cscso-web/src/marketingapp

question: What command builds the Angular web application image?
context: run -> “podman build -t cscso-web .”

question: How do you clean up dangling images in Podman?
context: Run this command to remove all the dangling images (<none> type images). “podman rmi -f $(podman images -filter "dangling=true" -q)”

question: What values must be updated in the docker-compose.yaml file?
context: Update the properties in docker-compose.yaml DB_URL, DB_USERNAME, DB_PASSWORD.

question: What command starts all containerized services using Podman Compose?
context: Run “podman compose -p cscsoapp up”

question: How can you visually confirm that all containers are running?
context: if you open your podman desktop and go to containers section, you can see all services in green, which means they are running.

answers.text: see all services in green in Podman Desktop containers section

question: What is the URL to log in to the SO 25.3 staging environment?
context: Login to 25.3 ST. https://ofss-mum-4923.snbomprshared2.gbucdsint02bom.oraclevcn.com:7443/cscapp/#/cscapp/login

question: What browser setting should be enabled before accessing the Supplier Onboarding tab?
context: Open Network Tab and check the “preserve log” checkbox.

question: What should you replace in the index.jsp URL to access the local containerized app?
context: Copy the complete URL to notepad and replace the base URL which is IP and Port with “localhost:8443”

question: What is the final URL format to access the containerized SO application locally?
context: https://localhost:8443/cscsoapp/index.jsp?USER_ID=SuperUserM&USER_AUTH_TOKEN=2YN7h_xFtKVEQKv35mN1Tr-&LAST_LOGIN_TIME=1756146600000&IS_GOBACK_ENABLED=Y&SESSION_TIME_OUT_INTRVL=900&USER_TYPE=BA&USER_LANG=EN&USER_TIME_ZONE_ID=HH

question: What is the purpose of steps 14–20 in the local containerized setup?
context: Note that the above steps are a shortcut to avoid setting up CSC_LOGIN APP and OLD_UX APP locally.

answers.text: to avoid setting up CSC_LOGIN APP and OLD_UX APP locally

question: What files are included in the required file changes for running apps locally?
context: Those contains changes in application.properties for all services, jks files, access tokens and app.service.ts and app.module.ts file changes.

answers.text: application.properties, jks files, access tokens, app.service.ts, and app.module.ts

question: How should you update backend services when running locally in Eclipse?
context: Update the DB details and so access tokens paths in application.properties if required and do Maven Update Force with VPN turned off.

answers.text: Update DB and token paths in application.properties and do Maven Update Force with VPN off

question: What command installs frontend dependencies in the Angular app?
context: Make sure VPN is disconnected, and do “npm i -f”

question: How do you start the backend Spring Boot services locally?
context: For backend Right Click > Run As > Spring Boot App

answers.text: Right Click > Run As > Spring Boot App

question: What command serves the Angular frontend during local development?
context: For frontend ng serve

question: On which URL is the locally served Angular frontend accessible?
context: Access it on http://localhost:4200

question: What must you do before switching from local IDE runs to containerized runs?
context: Whenever you want to containerize the application locally and run it locally in podman, make sure you revert the required file changes you have done for backend and frontend services.

answers.text: revert the required file changes made for local IDE runs

question: Which network dependency must be running when executing 'podman compose up'?
context: Connect to VPN again, Make sure wsl-vpn-kit is also running by doing wsl -l -v.

question: What are the two main ways to run the SO 25.3 applications locally as per the guide?
context: Now you have 2 options either containerize the applications and run them in podman or run them locally in STS or Eclipse.

answers.text: containerize and run in Podman, or run locally in STS/Eclipse
